thread.title: Food fests set for Brevard and Orlando
thread.title_full: Food fests set for Brevard and Orlando

title: Food fests set for Brevard and Orlando
text:
Food fests set for Brevard and Orlando Maria Sonnenberg, for FLORIDA TODAY 11:05 a.m. EDT October 14, 2015 Advance tickets are now on sale for the Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Food & Wine Classic, happening Oct. 30 and 31 at the Epcot resort area hotel. (Photo: Swan and Dolphin) 
Sample the dishes from well-known restaurants, as well as from newcomers to the area dining scene, during Cocoa Beach Regional Chamber of Commerce’s Taste of the Coast, when local eateries compete for the “People’s Choice” award. The graze fest takes place from 5 to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 23 at Cocoa Beach Country Club, 5000 Tom Warriner Blvd. 
Samplings include land and sea favorites, specialty appetizers and locally brewed and produced beverages. Admission, both general and VIP, includes sampling of all food and beverage offerings, but VIP admission includes early admission and a complimentary beverage. Additional beverages are available for purchase. Well-known local guitarist John Condon will provide entertainment. 
General admission is $20 per person in advance and $25 at the door. VIP admission is $40 in advance and $50 at the door. 
For more information and ticket purchases, call 321-459-2200 or visit cocoabeachchamber.com. Tickets may also be purchased at Chamber offices offices at 400 Fortenberry Road, Merritt Island, and at 2290 Town Center Ave., Suite 107, The Avenue Viera. 
Oktoberfest feast 
Heidelberg Restaurant offers a five-course wine tasting dinner at 6 p.m. Oct. 22. 
Enjoy a welcome toast of Lys Secco Rose before heading to the pumpkin squash soup, paired with Black Forest Girl Baden Dry. Additional courses, all accompanied with wines, include Gruyere dumplings with an organic kraut salad garnish, a four-season salad and diner’s choice of Brooke rainbow trout or tenderloin of Cheshire Farms pork. End the dinner with a cappuccino roll. 
Price is $85 per person. 
Reservations are requested. Call 321-783-6806. 
Classic fare 
Ten food and wine seminars are part of the Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Food & Wine Classic, happening from 5:30 to 9 p.m. Oct. 30 and 31 at the Epcot resort area hotel, 1500 Epcot Resorts Blvd., Lake Buena Vista. The event also celebrates its sixth year with 40 food and wine stations that feature global culinary specialties. 
Seminars on topics such as wine blending, Italian wines, champagne, beer, mixology, tequila, pasta making, sushi and sake, wine and cheese pairing and the Brazilian cocktail caipirinha offer guests the opportunity for hands-on educational experiences, according to a press release about the event. For seminar schedule, see SwanDolphinFoodandWineClassic.com. Review: Heidelberg in Cocoa Beach earns four stars 
After the seminars are over, guests can sip and savor along the hotel’s causeway. On Halloween night, add spooky fun to the mix. 
The two-night event introduces dishes, such as ginger-cured Hamachi with nitro lime, mascarpone chestnut ravioli with Italian sausage and celery root and bacon jus and smoked Wagyu short ribs accompanied by a parsnip puree, melba toast and pommery mustard sauce. Barbecue fans can enjoy signature dishes from the hotel’s executive chef, Robert Ciborowski. 
The Swan and Dolphin’s world champion pastry chef, Laurent Branlard, will serve desserts that include chocolate almond crunch cake and éclair with caramelized banana cream and coconut streusel. This year, Branlard is also introducing a S’more Sundae Action Station, which combines the classics of S’more and sundae. 
“This event is a way for us to celebrate our love of food, wine and beverage with others who share that same passion,” Tony Porcellini, the hotel’s director of food and beverage, said in a press release. 
“What continues to bring back people year after year is the one-of-a-kind, fun, street-party atmosphere our guests enjoy.” 
An upgraded ticket option offers a beer garden with a variety of local and seasonal brews from around the world, served with Oktoberfest-inspired cuisine. Review: Otjundu in Eau Gallie blends Africa, Germany 
Seminars require separate tickets in addition to the causeway tickets. 
Guests can also meet celebrity chef Todd English, namesake of the Swan and Dolphin’s Todd English’s bluezoo restaurant. 
Tickets for the Food & Wine Classic are sold individually, as well as at part of a hotel package. Advance event-only tickets are $105 and include unlimited food and beverage sampling. Upgraded tickets that include the beer garden are $125. Beverage seminars are $45 and pasta making and pairing seminars are $60. 
Two-night packages that include tickets to the outdoor festival for two and overnight accommodations, begin at $684. 
For more information, call 1-800-227-1500 or visit SwanDolphinFoodandWineClassic.com. 
Think pink 
There is still time to enjoy one of Panera Bread’s signature Pink Ribbon Bagels, available through the end of October at all of the bakery-café’s 1,500 locations. A portion of proceeds benefit breast cancer causes throughout the national. 
The Pink Ribbon Bagel features cherry chips, dried cherries and cranberries, vanilla, honey and brown sugar in the shape of the pink ribbon for breast cancer awareness. 
Pink Ribbon Bagels have raised more than $1 million for breast cancer charities. 
Panera locations in Brevard include 275 E. Eau Gallie Blvd., Melbourne; 245 Palm Bay Road, West Melbourne; 4100 N. Wickham Road, Melbourne, and 2290 Town Center Ave., at The Avenue Viera. 
For more information, see panerabread.com. 
Know of a chef or restaurant we should feature? Email toastofthecoast@cfl.rr.com. Read or Share this story: http://on.flatoday.com/1RHEJ7U TOP VIDEOS
